detailed_info.name: Sodium chloride
detailed_info.description: Sodium chloride is a sodium salt also known as table salt, commonly used in food for salting food. It is the basic material in the chemical industry to produce soda and chlorine. In cosmetics, it is often used as a thickener in shampoos and shower gels or in oral preparations to clean and eliminate odors. Table salt (depending on the concentration used) may tend in some cases to dry the skin and irritate the scalp. Sodium chloride is allowed in organic.

functions.name: Bulking
functions.description: Reduces apparent cosmetics density.

functions.name: Masking
functions.description: Reduces or inhibits the odor or basic taste of the product

functions.name: Oral care/hygiene agent
functions.description: Provides cosmetic effects to the oral cavity (cleaning, deodorization and protection)

functions.name: Viscosity controlling
functions.description: Increases or decreases the viscosity of cosmetics

functions.name: Cleansing
functions.description: Helps to keep a clean surface

functions.name: Foam boosting
functions.description: Improves the quality of the foam produced by increasing one or more of the following properties: volume, texture and/or stability

functions.name: Hair conditioning
functions.description: Leaves hair easy to comb, soft, soft and shiny and / or confers volume, lightness and shine

functions.name: Surfactant
functions.description: Reduces the surface tension of cosmetics and contributes to the even distribution of the product when it is used

functions.name: Antistatic
functions.description: Reduces static electricity by neutralizing electrical charge on a surface
